title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19ยง 80.5 - Inspection of records
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19ยง 80.5 - Inspection of records

State Regulations
(a) Requests
for public access to records shall be accepted during all hours the department
is regularly open for business. If access to records is granted, records may be
inspected by the public at the office of the records access officer every day
that the offices of the department are open for business during the hours 9
a.m. through 12 noon, and 1 p.m. through 4 p.m. Records may also be inspected
at an office of an assistant records access officer. (b) If a record is of a type available for
inspection under the Freedom of Information Law but contains information, details and/or particulars requiring deletion, a requester shall only be
permitted to inspect a copy of the record with deletions. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 19ยง
80.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
